channel.title: Running RSCAngel on P2P mode
channel.description:
I got it running in F2P mode, but not with P2P :confused:
I'm using runserver.bat with: [code]ant runf2p[/code] I checked in the build.xml that to run it in p2p mode it should be "ant runp2p" but it gives me this error:
[code]runp2p: [java] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 2 [java] at rsca.gs.Server.main(Server.java:46) [java] Java Result: 1
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 1 second[/code]
Edit: I removed this line from the Server.java [code]if (args[2] != null && args[2].equalsIgnoreCase("no"))[/code] And now it works :D

item.title: Running RSCAngel on P2P mode
item.dc:creator: @JUMPHIM JUMPHIM
item.description:
@JUMPHIM wrote:

[quote=“putaz, post:18, topic:395127”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=492316.msg3622573#msg3622573 date=1307561224]

May I ask what your quests have to do with this? Stay on the subject. stop talking about your server,.

I mean general RSC bugs (that are on every RSC private server, not just mine)…

And why should I stop talking about my ‘server’ in a forum designed for discussing RSC private servers? Who are you to say what I can or can’t post?
[/quote]
He asked for help, not what you have bugs in your server. Just think it is unnecessary to mention your server anywhere, why would you compare your server with all the others?
Everyone talks about RSCangel when kryptix talk about RSCEmulation

Kryptix (+10/-199) putaz (+10/-8) -1 twat - mscp In topic Today

This was a bit pointless to or what do you think?[/quote]
so kryptix did you delete my char? if ya didnt i would love to play your server again and dude from what i seen you have little to no bugs keep up the good work dude:) rsce all the wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

Read full topic

item.title: Running RSCAngel on P2P mode
item.dc:creator: @putaz putaz
item.description:
@putaz wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:5, topic:397769”]They’re arguably harder than what they’ve currently done though. It took us months to get all F2P quests functioning properly and even now bugs pop up now and again.

There’s a few bugs that haven’t ever been fixed too (I’m working on them).

Where do you stop though? We saw blatant typos in quest chats, are you meant to copy them or correct them? It starts getting a bit silly…

But yeah no one is even close to replicating RSC yet.[/quote]

May I ask what your quests have to do with this? Stay on the subject. stop talking about your server,.

Read full topic

item.title: Running RSCAngel on P2P mode
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:

what matters most is the “feel”…the closest server to it is moonspell/rscdef…

Read full topic

item.title: Running RSCAngel on P2P mode
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote author=xEnt link=topic=492316.msg3622190#msg3622190 date=1307520364]it’s very close actually, theres not a lot more that needs to be done. i assume your talking about some stupid client-side things to make it exactly how RSC was, if so that’s just stupid.

I’m talking about everything… Client side features, quests, item locations, NPC locations, NPC drop rates, general RSC behaviour (little things like rotating and facing a player if you click a tile that they’re on) and so on. I spent a long time on the above and I know RSCE is still miles away so it’s frustrating when people claim RSCA is practically done when in reality it isn’t even close, it’s just closer than RSCD…

It’s not until you get on a RSC acocunt and walk around the world comparing it to private servers that you realise it’s no where near. There’s so many missing items, objects, NPC’s wander differently, the drop rates are miles off, all the NPC handlers, the quests, the exact text of every action and so on… If I had enough time I’d make a huge list and then you’d realise just how far off it actually is.[/quote]
Yup. I’ve known it, but feature wise it’s pretty close, those are pretty minor things, about one line fixes, yet some need complete remake.

Read full topic

item.title: Running RSCAngel on P2P mode
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

I can read fine… You should word things more carefully. F2P isn’t replicated (or anywhere close), it’s simply further than RSCD…

it’s very close actually, theres not a lot more that needs to be done. i assume your talking about some stupid client-side things to make it exactly how RSC was, if so that’s just stupid.

Read full topic

item.description:
@putaz wrote:

lardlizard:

Where is snoopy when you need him?

You do not need him, RSCangel is quite simple to understand. All you need to know is in the server class file and the build xml file of course. If you upload these two files so I can probably figure it out for you

[/quote]

I got it running in F2P mode, but not with P2P

I’m using runserver.bat with:

I checked in the build.xml that to run it in p2p mode it should be “ant runp2p” but it gives me this error:

[code]runp2p:
[java] Exception in thread “main” java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException:
